intro: Zornia diphylla, commonly known as the two-leaved zornia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has alternate, pinnately compound leaves that are often hairy, and it produces small, legume-like pods that contain several seeds. Zornia diphylla is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in dry landscapes.
